document_title: Osteoarthritis of the wrist: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Athritis
This is the main symptom of wrist degeneration. The pain is mechanical in nature, it will increase when moving and decrease when resting, and the pain will increase when performing activities in the wrist such as holding objects. Depending on the severity, the pain can be dull or lasting. The level of joint pain will manifest as follows:
First stage: The patient will feel slight pain in the wrist, and there will be a rattling and crunching sound when active; Later stages: The pain becomes more severe and begins to gradually spread to surrounding locations.
Swelling and stiffness
Patients often feel stiff in the morning or after a long time of wrist inactivity. When the joints are swollen and stiff, it can cause many difficulties for you when rotating and bending your wrist, and your movements are no longer flexible and graceful.
Operations lack flexibility
If the illness lasts, you will have difficulty holding objects or performing personal activities. The grip strength of the hand is now weakened and the grip of the fingers is lost.
Muscle atrophy, loss of mobility
This is the most serious sign. Degeneration of the wrist joint causes the patient to lose the ability to move the wrist joint, muscle atrophy, joint deformity and complete loss of motor function.
